meaningMnemonic: You've hopefully seen 向く and 向ける by now. They mean "to face" and "to turn toward." This has a similar idea. When you add 向け to something imagine you're turning it, aiming it at someone. It's aimed at them, meaning it's <vocabulary>made for</vocabulary> them. Turn a book toward someone, now it's <vocabulary>aimed at</vocabulary> them, it's made for them. See the connection?
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the word 向く so work off of that word to be able to read this one.
